import asyncio
local_var = threading.local()

async def set_local(loop):
    local_var.x = 42
    await loop.run_in_executor(None, set_local)

async def get_local():

version_notes: Improved support for asyncio in Python 3.10

caveats: Thread-local variables are destroyed when the thread they are associated with is terminated
Using thread-local storage may introduce complexity into your code, especially when dealing with shared resources or multiple threads accessing the same data structure
It's important to use context managers for thread-local variables to ensure proper cleanup
